New Records: Freddie Freeman tied a World Series record with 12 runs batted in during the game.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers capitalized on defensive errors and misplays by the Yankees in the fifth inning to tie the game at 5-5.
Mookie Betts hit a sacrifice fly in the eighth inning to bring in the winning run and secure the Dodgers' victory.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees jumped out to an early 5-0 lead largely due to strong performances from Aaron Judge and Jazz Chisholm Jr., including a first-inning home run by Judge.
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees' defense collapsed in the fifth inning, leading to a series of errors that shifted momentum to the Dodgers.
Gerrit Cole, who started the game, failed to cover first base on a grounder, contributing to the Dodgers' rally.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers' ability to wear down the Yankees' pitching staff and capitalize on defensive miscues was a key factor in their victory.
This was the Dodgers' first World Series championship since 2020.
Others: The game included a series of key moments and defensive plays, including a critical grounder to first base that Cole failed to cover, leading to the tying runs.
